title: Pinterest Joins Surge of Tech-Related Companies Planning to Go Public
text: Image search site Pinterest Inc. revealed steady revenue gains with narrowing losses as well as a big bet on overseas expansion, as it joined a surge of technology-related companies planning to go public in the U.S.

title: MarketWatch First Take: Pinterest’s IPO filing: 5 things investors should know
text: Pinterest filed the first documents in its much anticipated initial public offering on Friday, and the 184-plus page S-1 had a surprise or two about the online image discovery company.

title: Pinterest's IPO filing shows how dependent websites and apps have become on Google and Facebook
text: Pinterest says changes by Google and Facebook in early 2018 negatively impacted its user growth.

title: Sell-off sparks concerns of global slow down and recession
text: Brian Sozzi, Myles Udland, Seana Smith and Julia LaRoche discuss why the sell-off happened.

title: Pinterest files for initial public offering
text: CNBC's Leslie Picker discusses the breaking news that Pinterest has filed for its IPO under the ticker symbol "PINS."

title: Pinterest just dropped its filing to go public, revealing financials for the first time
text: Pinterest is joining a bevy of tech companies going public in 2019.

title: Timing of next recession depends on trade deal, says Schwab's Sonders
text: Liz Ann Sonders, chief investment strategist at Charles Schwab, discusses the market selloff with CNBC's "Closing Bell."

title: 'Inverted yield curve is a flashing yellow light,' says strategist
text: Sun Trust Strategist Keith Lerner discusses the market sell-off and the inverted yield curve on the 10-year-treasury note that may be pointing to a recession and a slower growth outlook.

title: What an inverted yield curve means to the market
text: CNBC's Mike Santoli and Rick Santelli break down what the yield curve may be signaling for the market and how a yield curve works.

title: Deep Dive: Stocks took a big hit Friday, and these shares fell the most
text: Nike led the Dow Jones Industrial Average lower as bond investors sent a clear signal they expect the economic expansion to end.

title: Rally off December's lows is still intact, says strategist
text: Brian Strazzullo of Bell Curve Trading joins CNBC's Melissa Lee at the telestrator to break down market technicals that may indicate that the rally off of the late December lows is still intact.

title: Software maker Zoom Communications files IPO documents
text: Zoom Communications Inc. filed its initial public offering documents Friday and plans to list under the ticker ZM on the Nasdaq Global Select Market.

title: Video-conferencing company Zoom files to go public with over $300 million in revenue
text: Zoom, which provides video-conferencing software that can be used across devices, filed its IPO prospectus on Friday, joining a crop of Bay Area start-ups preparing to hit the public markets.

title: Consumer sentiment remains strong despite global slowdown
text: Nick Setyan, Wedbush Securities managing director, and CNBC's Kate Rogers join 'The Exchange' to discuss how the global slowdown is impacting U.S. restaurants.

title: Brewers of all sizes are being hurt by aluminum tariffs, The Beer Institute CEO says
text: Jim McGreevy, The Beer Institute president and CEO, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss how aluminium tariffs are hurting brewers and how they're working with the weight.

title: Reading too much into yield curve is a mistake at this point, says CIO
text: CNBC's "Power Lunch" team is joined by Ron Insana, CNBC contributor and senior advisor to Schroders North America, and Krishna Memani, chief investment officer with Oppenheimer Funds, to break down how the markets are reacting today as well as what the yield curve represents at this time.

title: Not Out Of Harm's Way? Stocks Vulnerable to Potential Trade, Brexit Fallout: Market Watcher
text: Crossmark Global Investments' Victoria Fernandez is keeping her investment strategy nimble to cope with geopolitical risks.

title: How Scott Coyle Is Opening Up The IPO Process To Retail Investors
text: Benzinga's Fintech Focus Podcast features conversations with the biggest names in fintech.

title: It's time to put bonds in your portfolio, says BlackRock's Global CIO
text: Rick Rieder, BlackRock Global CIO of fixed income, calls into 'Fast Money Halftime Report' to discuss the mid-day markets amid concerns of an economic slowdown. He also weighs in on the Fed's dovish call.

title: Fed is going to drive us into a recession, says Canaccord Genuity chief market strategist
text: Tony Dwyer, Canaccord Genuity chief equity strategist, calls into 'Fast Money Halftime Report' to discuss the mid-day markets amid concerns of an economic slowdown. He also shares his thoughts on the Fed's dovish call.

title: Slow economic growth is not a shock, says CEO
text: Shannon Saccocia, Boston Private Wealth CIO, and Michael Farr, president and CEO of Farr, Miller and Washington, join CNBC's "Fast Money Halftime Report" to discuss the mid-day market amid concerns of a global slowdown.

title: Stash and Green Dot CEOs: Making Money by Spending
text: Jim Cramer speaks sits down with Green Dot CEO Steven Streit and Stash CEO Brandon Krieg to hear how the companies have partnered to help users save money through everyday spending.

title: ETF Investors Bring Risk-On Mentality to U.S. Inflows
text: Mar.22 -- Bloomberg Intelligence's Athanasios Psarofagis examines weekly ETF inflows for U.S. and European equities. He speaks on "Bloomberg Markets."

title: Demand for IPOs seems infinite, but could face 'reckoning,' says Larry Haverty
text: David Ethridge, U.S. IPO services leader at PWC, and Larry Haverty, managing director at LJH Investment Advisors, discuss the expected wave of IPOs in 2019 with "Squawk Alley". Some of the most anticipated names are Lyft, Uber and Pinterest.

title: Uber vs. Lyft: Which Is the Better Autonomous Vehicle Company?
text: These two ride-sharing juggernauts are gearing up for a self-driving future.

title: Baird Declares 'Party's Over' for U.S. Financials
text: Mar.22 -- David George, senior research analyst at Baird, discusses his expectation for banks' net interest margins to be reduced by a lack of interest rate hikes. He speaks with Bloomberg's Jonathan Ferro on "Bloomberg Markets: The Open."

title: Market skepticism keeps prevailing amongst investors, says strategist
text: Tobias Levkovich, Citi chief U.S. equity strategist, discusses the market sell-off and pressures on the economy with "Squawk on the Street".

title: What Is Lyft Worth?
text: Morningstar's Ali Mogharabi gives his take on the company's value, how it stacks up against Uber, and the threat that regulation poses

title: Investors Readjust to Lower-for-Longer Interest Rates
text: Mar.22 -- Diana Jaffee, senior portfolio manager at TCW Group, Michael Kushma, global fixed income chief investment officer at Morgan Stanley Investment Management, and Noah Weisberger, managing director at Sanford Bernstein, discus expectations for lower interest rates. They speak with Bloomberg's Jonathan Ferro on "Bloomberg Markets: The Open."

title: Uber faces fresh legal challenge over driver data
text: Uber drivers in the U.K. are filing a lawsuit against the company over allegations the firm has continuously broken European data protection laws.

title: Dow slides more than 250 points as fears of global slowdown persist
text: CNBC's Bob Pisani looks ahead at the day's market action.

title: How Rent the Runway Built Unicorn Status on Sharing Economy
text: Mar.22 -- Jennifer Hyman, co-founder and chief executive officer at Rent the Runway, discusses reaching a $1 billion valuation following its latest round of funding, the evolution of the business, and customer adoption of their subscription service. Mike Wilson, chief U.S. equity strategist at Morgan Stanley, joins the conversation on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: What You Need To Know About The Lyft IPO: Strong Investor Demand and Strong ESG Characteristics
text: Sharing economy unicorn Lyft has turned to the public markets for growth capital.

title: China-US deal would be a win-win situation for the entire globe: Strategist | Squawk Box Europe
text: Fahad Kamal, chief market strategist at Kleinwort Hambros, discusses the Sino-U.S. trade conflict.

title: Economist Daco Sees Bond Yields Dampened by Inflation Expectations
text: Mar.22 -- In "Single Best Chart," Gregory Daco, chief U.S. economist at Oxford Economics, discusses the impact of inflation expectations on global bond yields. He speaks with Bloomberg's Taylor Riggs on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

title: A strong public market will drive innovation in tech, says Revolution CEO Steve Case
text: Steve Case, CEO of Revolution, joins "Squawk Box" to talk about the highly anticipated tech IPOs such as Uber, Pinterest and Lyft.

title: Investors try to determine whether Lyft's IPO valuation is expensive or cheap
text: CNBC's Leslie Picker joins "Squawk Box" to report on the latest news in tech IPOs. On the watch list are big companies like Uber, Pinterest and Lyft.

title: German Manufacturing Slump Deals Blow to Euro Economy Outlook
text: Mar.22 -- A euro-area Purchasing Managers Index signaled 0.2 percent growth this quarter as German manufacturing suffered its deepest slump in six years. Bloomberg's John Ainger reports on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: Rent the Runway CEO: The sharing economy is the future of retail
text: Rent the Runway CEO Jennifer Hyman sits down with "Squawk Box" as the company hits a $1 billion valuation. The discussion touches on the apparel sector, the sharing economy and how millennial are changing the consumer landscape.

title: Former Aetna CEO Mark Bertolini on 'Medicare for All': No one can explain to me what it is
text: Former Aetna CEO Mark Bertolini joins "Squawk Box" to talk about the state of the health care industry. The discussion touches on how the U.S. can improve its system, socialized medicine, and the recent Biogen Alzheimer's trial cancellation.

title: Watch one strategist explain how investors can protect their profits amid global uncertainty
text: Hank Smith, chief investment officer at Haverford Trust, and Kathryn Rooney Vera, head of global research and chief investment strategist at Bulltick Capital Markets, join "Squawk Box" to discuss how the turmoil in the global economy as well as the various trade wars around the world might be affecting the markets.

title: Are Corporate Profits Starting to Show the Strain of Trade Sanctions?
text: Mar.22 -- Mark Burgess, deputy global chief investment officer at Columbia Threadneedle Investments, discusses the impact of trade sanctions on financial markets and corporate earnings. He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

title: Stocks Mixed; Gold Climbs As Bonds Hold Advances: Markets Wrap
text: Global stocks traded mixed while gold advanced and bonds held recent gains as investors reassess prospects for the major central banks to monetary policy.

title: NYSE reportedly won the Uber and Pinterest IPO listings
text: Uber Technologies and Pinterest have picked the New York Stock Exchange as the venue for their stock listings, according to sources familiar with the matter.

title: How To Buy A Profitable FinTech Stock Before The Big Investors
text: It's no surprise that American consumers are rapidly shifting away from cash to digital payments.
